tags.name: d-alert
tags.description: A simple coloured alert to display update information to the user. Commonly used to display error or success messages after a submission or interaction.

attributes.name: colour
attributes.description: A the colour to fill the alert with. Default is `warning`.

attributes.name: closeable
attributes.description: If true, a close button is displayed and the element will be removed when it is clicked. Be careful when using with JS frameworks, consider a custom implementation in that scenario.

tags.name: d-card
tags.description:
A card to segment content in the document flow. Useful for grouped information so as to easily display those divisions to the user.

Slots: `default`, `title`

attributes.name: colour
attributes.description: A colour to fill the card with. Default is `surface`

tags.name: d-carousel
tags.description: A simple carousel to display slides to the user. Each child should be assigned to a slot with any name. The user will then be able to cycle between each child in turn.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the carousel and, as such, each slide. Should be a CSS height value. Default is `30rem`.

attributes.name: no-tabs
attributes.description: If true, the navigation tabs at the bottom of the slides will not be displayed.

tags.name: d-listgroup
tags.description: Uses the children to display a list of items. Each one a block with a standard border. Only `span` and `a` tags as children are supported. The children may have a theme colour as a class name in order to style them.

tags.name: d-loading
tags.description: A loading overlay that covers the whole page. Should be used sparingly

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: If true then the overlay will render

tags.name: d-panel
tags.description: A simple panel to set the colour of a block. Offers no padding and no borders by default.

attributes.name: colour
attributes.description: The colour for the block. Will update background and text colour. Default is `body`.

attributes.name: bordered
attributes.description: If set then the panel will have a border and shadow but still no padding.

tags.name: d-progress
tags.description: A simple progress bar. Children can be used to set display text.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A percentage value of the progress. Should not include anything other than numbers and a decimal place.

attributes.name: colour
attributes.description: The colour for the progress foreground. The background will always be surface

tags.name: f-button
tags.description: A simple button that the user can click for various actions. If the `type` is included then the button can be a standard or submit button. If the `href` is included the the button is a link. Buttons that are placed next to other buttons will automatically merge into a group.

attributes.name: colour
attributes.description: The colour for the button to render. Default is `primary`.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The button type when used as a standard button. Should not be included with `href`.

values.name: button
values.description: Use if the button should do nothing and you intend to handle click events for yourself.

values.name: submit
values.description: Use if the button is within a `form` tag and you intend for the button to submit said form.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: The URL to send the user to if the button is being used as a link. Should not be included with `type`.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: The standard target from an anchor element. Should only be included if `href` is present.

attributes.name: private
attributes.description: If set then the link will be treated as external. This means that `rel="noreferrer noopener"` will be applied.

tags.name: f-date
tags.description:
A form data picker. Must be placed within a `form` tag.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The initial date to display to the user. Defaults to the current date. Should be in `yyyy-mm-dd` format.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has a value.

tags.name: f-image
tags.description:
A upload box for images. Must be placed within a `form` tag.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has a value.

tags.name: f-input
tags.description:
A single line text input. Must be placed within a `form` tag.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The initial value of the textbox.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The keyboard to be used for the input when using a mobile device. Defaults to `text`.

attributes.name: sensitive
attributes.description: If set then the form element is hidden from the user. Useful for password inputs.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has a value.

attributes.name: validate
attributes.description: A RegExp string used to evaluate the input. If there are no matches then the field will be considered invalid and the form will not be submittable.

tags.name: f-multiselect
tags.description:
A list of items, of which the user can select any number.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The default selected items. Should be comma separated with no whitespace between.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has a value.

attributes.name: validate
attributes.description: A RegExp string used to evaluate the input. If there are no matches then the field will be considered invalid and the form will not be submittable. Remember that the value is a comma separated string of all of the selected options.

tags.name: f-richtext
tags.description:
A multi line rich text input form element. Must be placed within a `form` tag.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The initial value of the textbox.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The keyboard to be used for the input when using a mobile device. Defaults to `text`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has a value.

attributes.name: validate
attributes.description: A RegExp string used to evaluate the input. If there are no matches then the field will be considered invalid and the form will not be submittable. Remember that the value will be HTML.

tags.name: f-select
tags.description:
A dropdown select. Must be placed within a `form` tag.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The initial value to be selected.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has a value.

attributes.name: validate
attributes.description: A RegExp string used to evaluate the input. If there are no matches then the field will be considered invalid and the form will not be submittable.

tags.name: f-singleselect
tags.description:
A list of items, of which the user can select a single item. Must be placed within a `form` tag.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The default selected item.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has a value.

attributes.name: validate
attributes.description: A RegExp string used to evaluate the input. If there are no matches then the field will be considered invalid and the form will not be submittable.

tags.name: f-textarea
tags.description:
A multi line plain text input. Must be placed within a `form` tag.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The keyboard to be used for the input when using a mobile device. Defaults to `text`.

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The default text for the textbox.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has a value.

attributes.name: validate
attributes.description: A RegExp string used to evaluate the input. If there are no matches then the field will be considered invalid and the form will not be submittable.

tags.name: f-toggle
tags.description:
A box to toggle between two options. Must be placed within a `form` tag.

Slots: `default` - Label text, `help` - Small help text, `empty` - Error text for empty, `invalid` - Error text for invalid value

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: The default text for the textbox.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If set then the form element is read only.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the value field in the form data. Should be unique.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If true then the form will not be submittable until the element field has the value of `on`.

tags.name: l-accordion
tags.description: An accordion item that is expanded with a click. If another accordion within the parent is opened then it will collapse automatically.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: If set then the accordion item defaults to open on load.

attributes.name: independent
attributes.description: If set then the accordion item will not close when another one opens.

tags.name: l-col
tags.description: A column within a grid. They can wrap on to new lines without upsetting the flow.

attributes.name: flush
attributes.description: If true then the element will not have padding.

attributes.name: xs
attributes.description: The size of the column on the smallest screen size. Should always be set for predictable behaviour.

attributes.name: sm
attributes.description: The size of the column on small screens.

attributes.name: md
attributes.description: The size of the column on medium screens.

attributes.name: lg
attributes.description: The size of the column on large screens.

attributes.name: xl
attributes.description: The size of the column on extra large screens.

tags.name: l-container
tags.description: A container for the grid. Allows for predictable document widths.

attributes.name: flush
attributes.description: If true then the element will always fill the screen. Consider the need for this element in this scenario.

tags.name: l-header
tags.description:
A header for your site. A logo is a must if you are using this.

Slots: `default`, `right`

attributes.name: logo
attributes.description: The URL for the company logo. Best if it is rather small and mostly square.

attributes.name: logo-alt
attributes.description: The alt text for if the company logo can not be loaded.

attributes.name: bg
attributes.description: The background colour for the header.

attributes.name: flush
attributes.description: If true then the header will span the width of the screen. Use if using a flush container or not using a container for your page body.

tags.name: l-row
tags.description: A row to contain `l-col` tags.

attributes.name: cols
attributes.description: The number of columns to have per row. The default is 12.

tags.name: l-table
tags.description:
A data table to display tabular data to the user. Intentionally limited. Only intended to be used for actual data. If you require interaction then consider using a solution with list groups or cards. Should only contain `table-row` and `table-cell` tags.

Slots: `default` - The body schema, `head` - The head schema

attributes.name: use
attributes.description: A JavaScript snippet to get the data from the `u-` namespace.

tags.name: table-row
tags.description: A data tag for a row in a table.

tags.name: table-cell
tags.description: A data tag for a cell in a table

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the cell in the table

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the cell in the table

attributes.name: colspan
attributes.description: The colspan of the cell in the table

attributes.name: rowspan
attributes.description: The rowspan of the cell in the table

tags.name: l-templated
tags.description: Insert a generic template into the project. Should only be used with trusted data.

attributes.name: use
attributes.description: The HTML ID or URL of the template desired. If a HTML ID then it should point to a `template` tag. If a URL then it should point to a HTML file. That file should contain no `html` or `body` tags and should only container the content as if it was in a `template` tag.

attributes.name: remote
attributes.description: If set then the use attribute will be treated as a URL. If not then it will be treated as a HTML ID.

tags.name: o-dropdown
tags.description: A simple dropdown that can be triggered by a separate element on the page. It is automatically position below its target.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: A CSS selector for the desired target. It will listen for click events from any element matching that selector and will position below the one that is clicked.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the dropdown menu. If unset then the width of the target will be used. Should be a CSS width.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The max height of the drop down. Default is `12rem`.

attributes.name: scrollable
attributes.description: If true then the dropdown will have a scroll bar when there are too many elements within.

tags.name: o-modal
tags.description:
A modal dialogue to be triggered by another element on the screen.

Slots: `default`, `title`, `footer`

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description: A CSS selector to listen to for opening the dialogue. Will listen for clicks of any elements matching the selector.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the modal on the screen

tags.name: o-offcanvas
tags.description:
A offcanvas dialogue to be triggered by another element on the screen.

Slots: `default`, `title`, `footer`

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description: A CSS selector to listen to for opening the dialogue. Will listen for clicks of any elements matching the selector.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the modal on the screen

tags.name: o-toast
tags.description:
A small window to display notification information to the user.

Slots: `default`, `title`

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Image URL for the icon

attributes.name: metric
attributes.description: Numeric information for relevant metrics such as how long ago or distance.

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description: The unit for the metric. Conforms to the Intl.NumberFormat constructor. Default is `minute`

attributes.name: unit-display
attributes.description: The length of display for the unit. Conforms to the Intl.NumberFormat constructor. Default is `short`

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: Where on the screen shall it render? Default is `bottom right`

tags.name: t-badge
tags.description: A badge designed for a number to site at the top right of the block it is within

attributes.name: colour
attributes.description: The colour of the badge. Default is `warning`

tags.name: t-code
tags.description: A code highlighter. It uses highlight.js to correctly colour code.

attributes.name: language
attributes.description: The name of a language as listed in highlight.js

attributes.name: file
attributes.description: A file name string to be used for decoration.

attributes.name: use
attributes.description: A JavaScript snippet to extract the data from the `u-` namespace.

attributes.name: flush
attributes.description: If true then no padding or borders will be applied.

tags.name: t-crumbs
tags.description: Breadcrumbs designed to inform the user of the path to the current page. Only `span` and `a` tags are accepted as children.

attributes.name: divider
attributes.description: The character that should be used to separate the crumbs. Defaults to `/`

attributes.name: colour
attributes.description: The text colour for anchor crumbs. Default is `primary`

tags.name: t-heading
tags.description: A HTML heading tag.

attributes.name: level
attributes.description: The heading level

attributes.name: display
attributes.description: If true then larger but thinner fonts will be used to make the text stand out

tags.name: t-icon
tags.description: A icon from RemixIcon to be used to provide richness to a document.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name taken from RemixIcon

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: If true then the filled variant of the RemixIcon will be used.

attributes.name: plain
attributes.description: Certain icons do not have a fill or outlined variant. Set this to true if that is the case for you.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: A size of one of the text variants from the theme. Use `body` and `body_large` for paragraph sizes. Use `h{NUMBER}_display` for display headings. Default is `body`.

attributes.name: colour
attributes.description: The colour of the icon. Default is `body`.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: If set to true then the text colour from the provided theme colour will be used.

attributes.name: spin
attributes.description: If true then the icon will spin. Useful for loading indicators.

tags.name: t-link
tags.description: A styled link for usage around the site

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: The URL to send the user to if the button is being used as a link.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: The standard target from an anchor element.

attributes.name: private
attributes.description: If set then the link will be treated as external. This means that `rel="noreferrer noopener"` will be applied.

attributes.name: block
attributes.description: If set then the link will be displayed as a block rather than an inline block.

tags.name: t-localised
tags.description: Only displays text for the preferred locale of the user. Put content in a slot with the name of the locale it is written in. If there is no content in the slot with the preferred locale of the user, content from the unnamed slot will be used as a fallback.

tags.name: t-paragraph
tags.description: A paragraph element

attributes.name: large
attributes.description: If set then larger text is displayed

tags.name: t-richtext
tags.description: Display rich text from a text editor. Will filter the content to make sure that nothing harmful is displayed to the user.

attributes.name: use
attributes.description: A JavaScript snippet to access the data from the `u-` namespace

tags.name: u-each
tags.description: Repeats its children once for each item accessed from the context.

attributes.name: subject
attributes.description: A JavaScript snippet to extract the array from the context.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name to use in sub items to extract the item from the context.

tags.name: u-fetch
tags.description: Fetches data from a URL and adds them to the context.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: The main URL to use. May include parameters like `{locale}` to customise the URL for the user.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name given to the result in the context.

attributes.name: fallback
attributes.description: The fallback URL for if the fetch fails. Useful for when fetching locale specific data from a CMS.

attributes.name: no-cache
attributes.description: By default all data is cached on the users machine. If set then that cache is disabled. Only use if you have to.

tags.name: u-global
tags.description: Accesses data from the `window` object and adds it to the context.

attributes.name: var
attributes.description: The key used on the `window` object

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name given to the result in the context.

tags.name: u-if
tags.description: Will only render its children if data retrieved from the context is truthy.

attributes.name: check
attributes.description: The JavaScript snippet used to get the data from the context.

tags.name: u-paginator
tags.description: Paginate using the context for data management. It will provide `{skip}` and `{take}` options to any `u-fetch` element containing it.

attributes.name: total
attributes.description: The JavaScript snippet used to get the data from the context. Should result in a number showing the total items available.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The page size. Default is `50`

tags.name: u-text
tags.description: Get a string from the context and place it into the dom. Will display a placeholder if no data is present.

attributes.name: use
attributes.description: The JavaScript snippet to get the data from the context.

attributes.name: lines
attributes.description: The number of lines for the placeholder. Defaults to 1.

values.name: body
values.description: The main colour for the site, used for the body background colour.

values.name: headline
values.description: Background from the body colour but with a darker text so as to stand out.

values.name: surface
values.description: For blocks to stand out from rest of the document body. Should still be part of the document flow. Useful for things like cards and inputs.

values.name: contrast
values.description: The opposite of surface. Part of the standard document flow but darker and normal text colour. Should be used for aside content.

values.name: primary
values.description: The primary theme colour for the site. Should be used for most buttons and interactive content. Normally used for the site header.

values.name: warning
values.description: Normally red. Used to indicate issues that require the immediate attention of the user. Normally form submission errors.

values.name: rainbow_0
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_1
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_2
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_3
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_4
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_5
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_6
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_7
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_8
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_9
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.
true

values.name: _self
values.description: the current browsing context. (Default)

values.name: _blank
values.description: usually a new tab, but users can configure browsers to open a new window instead.

values.name: _parent
values.description: the parent browsing context of the current one. If no parent, behaves as `_self`.

values.name: _top
values.description: the topmost browsing context (the "highest" context that's an ancestor of the current one). If no ancestors, behaves as `_self`.

values.name: none
values.description: No virtual keyboard. For when the page implements its own keyboard input control.

values.name: text
values.description: Standard input keyboard for the user's current locale.

values.name: decimal
values.description: Fractional numeric input keyboard containing the digits and decimal separator for the user's locale (typically . or ,). Devices may or may not show a minus key (-).

values.name: numeric
values.description: Numeric input keyboard, but only requires the digits 0-9. Devices may or may not show a minus key.

values.name: tel
values.description: A telephone keypad input, including the digits 0-9, the asterisk (*), and the pound (#) key.

values.name: search
values.description: A virtual keyboard optimized for search input. For instance, the return/submit key may be labeled "Search", along with possible other optimizations.

values.name: email
values.description: A virtual keyboard optimized for entering email addresses. Typically includes the @character as well as other optimizations.

values.name: url
values.description: A keypad optimized for entering URLs. This may have the / key more prominent, for example. Enhanced features could include history access and so on.
